text:
Hey everyone. When creating templates we can access certain parts of modules to change text and colours like so…but how do we grab custom style tab options??

```{% module "hero-banner" path="/globalexpansion-2021/src/modules/hero-banner.module", label="Hero Banner", hero_content={'hero_heading': "Test"} %}```

Hi Scott,
You can work with the "style" tab (style fields) directly in the design manager or you can create the "style" tab locally and then use "watch" to update the module remotely.
You can find useful information about this <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields-overview#style-fields|here>

<@UGMGP7A72> You can set them how you normally would - as you listed above but through the styles param
```{% module ... 
   styles= {
       your_filed: "your_value"
   }
%}```

BUG: get_asset_url inside of fields.json seemingly not working any more
==================

I feel like ive been using get_asset_url() in fields.json in past theme builds and it’s worked fine to grab and access default images that port around with my theme. However now I am running into an issue where its not able to be accessed in statement form. It is, however, working when I `pprint` it.

Example:
In the images below you can see that im using the same statement reference — the only difference being that I pprint the one up top and dont in the one below. The output shows that the pprint is clearly returning a value, and if you visit the link it is the desired image, and the non pprinted statement returns nothing.

Thoughts?
